intro: Diplothemium campestre, commonly known as the field thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a robust stem covered in coarse, prickly hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in a cylindrical inflorescence. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a waxy coating and sharp margins, often forming a basal rosette. The plant is adapted to dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
